sections.title: Contribution Tracking
sections.markdown:
- **Method:** GitHub `CONTRIBUTING.md`
- **Focus:** Significant efforts, not hours
- **No credentials:** Hard rule — AKV only
- **Audit:** Git history for changes

sections.title: Change Management
sections.markdown:
**Production Deployment Approval**
- Non-breaking changes → Service owner approval + tests pass + PR deployment plan
- Breaking changes → Founders consensus + migration guide + customer comms + rollback plan
- Database migrations → 2 founders + backup verified + rollback tested + off-peak window
- Emergency hotfixes → On-call authority; inform founders within 1 hour; post-incident review in 24 hours

**Feature Flag Governance**
- Create new flags → Founder review + cleanup plan + monitoring plan
- Toggle in prod → Service owner; logged to audit trail; rollback plan ready
- Retire flags → Remove after 2 sprints at 100% rollout

sections.title: Data Governance
sections.description: PII handling, retention, and GDPR commitments.
sections.markdown:
**PII Handling**
- PII includes emails, IPs, payment data, auth tokens, and identifiers
- Encrypted at rest (AES-256) + in transit (TLS 1.3)
- Never logged in plaintext; masked in non-prod
- Access logged to audit trail

**Retention Policies**
- Active accounts → Retain while active
- Billing history → 7 years (tax)
- Soft delete → 30 days
- Hard delete → Purge PII after 30 days
- Backups → 30-day retention; PITR 7 days
- Deleted PII purged from backups after 30 days

**Backup/Restore Authority**
- Daily production DB backups (service owner monitors)
- Restore non-prod → Service owner authority
- Restore prod → 2 founders + justification + test in non-prod first
- Customer notification if data loss possible

**GDPR Compliance**
- Right to access → Self-service export; 48 hours
- Right to erasure → 7-day review + founder approval + delete within 30 days
- Portability → JSON export excluding derived analytics/IDs

**Customer Data Requests**
- Support access → Logged; customer notified
- Law enforcement → Founders + legal review; notify customer unless prohibited

sections.title: API & Integration Governance
sections.description: Versioning, deprecation, integrations, and rate limits.
sections.markdown:
**API Versioning & Deprecation**
- Version negotiation → Prefer URL (`/api/v1`); allow query/header for compatibility
- Major versions only in code; minor changes are additive
- Gateway defines external contract; internal services version interfaces too
- Breaking changes include error shapes, pagination defaults, response schema
- Deprecation headers → RFC 8594 Sunset + documented timelines
- Hard cutoffs → Sunset dates enforced (no extensions unless Adama says so)
- Version dashboards → Per-version latency, error rate, usage

**Deprecation Process**
1. Announce deprecation (docs + email + release notes)
2. Return Sunset + Deprecation headers
3. 6-month minimum notice before sunset
4. Reminder cadence at 6mo, 3mo, 1mo, 1wk
5. Sunset date → Return 410 Gone

**Third-Party Integrations**
- New integration → Service owner proposal + founders security/compliance review
- Cost evaluation required; founders consensus for approval
- Breaking integration changes → Founders review
- Non-breaking changes → Service owner authority

**Webhooks & Callbacks**
- New webhooks → Service owner; documented in API docs
- Breaking payload change → New API version
- Non-breaking payload change → Service owner + customer notice

**Rate Limit Policy**
- Free tier → 100 requests/hour
- Paid tier → 1000 requests/hour
- Increase limits → Service owner authority
- Decrease limits → Founders consensus + 30-day notice

sections.title: Financial Controls
sections.markdown:
- All recurring vendor costs tracked in a shared ledger
- Monthly spend review by founders
- Any contract over $500/month requires founders approval
- Billing issues prioritized as Sev-1 incidents

sections.title: Support & SLA
sections.markdown:
- Community support for free tier
- 24/7 support for paid tiers (target)
- Incident response within 1 hour for Sev-1
- Post-incident reviews within 24 hours
